p: The human respiratory syncytial virus (HRSV) is a member of the order Mononegavirales (mono, from Greek, meaning “single, simple”; nega, from Latin, meaning “RNA negative polarity”; virales, from Latin, meaning virus), classified within the Pneumoviridae family and the genus Orthopneumovirus. Other members of the Orthopneumovirus genus are the bovine respiratory syncytial virus (BRSV) and the pneumonia virus of mice (murine pneumonia virus) [ 125].
